department: Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (Department Of)
short_summary: Replacement of storm and sewage pumps at the Embassy of Canada to China in Beijing
description: His Majesty the King in right of Canada, represented by the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD), is initiating a process to prequalify contractors for the replacement of the storm pump system and the sewage pump system at the Embassy of Canada to China in Beijing.
full_summary:
### Replacement of Storm and Sewage Pumps at the Embassy of Canada to China in Beijing

#### Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) Solicitation No. 21-179584/C

* **Title:** Replacement of Storm and Sewage Pumps at the Embassy of Canada to China in Beijing
* **Reference Number:** PW-23-01027919
* **Amendment Number:** 1
* **Publication Date:** February 27, 2023
* **Closing Date and Time:** March 28, 2023, 14:00:00 EST
* **Trade Agreement:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Contact Information:**
	+ Name: Eric Rainville
	+ Email: [realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca](mailto:realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca)
	+ Phone: +1 343 572 7269
	+ Address: 125 Sussex Drive, Ottawa, ON, K1A 0G2, Canada

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) invites qualified contractors to prequalify for the replacement of the storm pump system and the sewage pump system at the Embassy of Canada to China in Beijing. This is a public notice on an Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) solicitation, with a closing date of March 28, 2023.

**Project Overview:**
The replacement project includes the supply and installation of six (6) new submersible pumps for the sewage and storm water lift stations, as well as the removal and disposal of the existing submersible pumps. Additionally, the project will comprise the removal of existing and installation of new mechanical, plumbing/piping, and electrical components.

**Required Qualifications:**
.bidders are required to demonstrate capability to provide a full range of services in English or French and have the ability to travel to and perform work in Beijing, China.

To be eligible to submit a bid, contractors must prequalify by responding to this ITQ. A detailed Request for Qualifications (RFQ) document and any associated addenda are available on the [CanadaBuys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca).

**Contact Information:**
For any questions or concerns, please contact Eric Rainville at [realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca](mailto:realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca) or +1 343 572 7269.
